15654.name: abnormal azygoesophageal recess
15654.description: Altered contour or appearance of the azygoesophageal recess, which may indicate mediastinal or esophageal pathology.

13577.name: abnormal position of the heart
13577.description: The heart is positioned abnormally within the thoracic cavity.

31047.name: abnormal sternoclavicular joint
31047.description: Any irregularity in the morphology or alignment of the sternoclavicular joint.

31046.name: abnormal sternomanubrial synchondrosis
31046.description: Abnormality at the junction between the sternum and manubrium, such as widening or irregularity.

31729.name: absent clavicle
31729.description: Congenital absence of the clavicle, often associated with syndromes such as cleidocranial dysostosis.

57.name: achalasia
57.description: Esophageal motility disorder resulting in failure of the lower esophageal sphincter to relax.

14420.name: acute diffuse fine reticular lung opacities
14420.description: Widespread fine linear densities throughout the lungs often consistent with an interstitial process.

15701.name: acute diffuse mediastinal widening
15701.description: Rapidly developing enlargement of the mediastinum which may indicate hemorrhage or mass.

14268.name: acute disseminated airspace opacity
14268.description: Widespread new opacity in the lung airspaces, suggesting acute pulmonary process.

14342.name: acute lung injury and ards in children
14342.description: Acute diffuse lung damage leading to hypoxia and bilateral infiltrates in children.

32919.name: acute mediastinitis
32919.description: Acute infection and inflammation of mediastinal tissues.

14326.name: acute respiratory distress syndrome
14326.description: Severe acute pulmonary condition with diffuse alveolar damage and hypoxemia.

13501.name: acyanotic congenital heart disease with increased pulmonary vascularity
13501.description: Congenital cardiac malformations that do not cause cyanosis and result in increased blood flow to the lungs.

13493.name: acyanotic congenital heart disease with normal pulmonary vascularity
13493.description: Acyanotic congenital cardiac malformations with normal pulmonary blood flow.

56.name: air in esophagus
56.description: Presence of gas within the esophageal lumen, which may be normal or pathologic.

14370.name: air-space opacity in leukemia or lymphoma
14370.description: Pulmonary opacities occurring in patients with leukemia or lymphoma, often due to infection, hemorrhage, or infiltration.

14175.name: alveolar lung disease
14175.description: Pulmonary process characterized by filling of alveolar spaces, seen as airspace opacification.

13557.name: anomalous thoracic arterial communication
13557.description: Abnormal vascular connection between thoracic arteries.

14153.name: anomaly of inferior vena cava
14153.description: Congenital or acquired abnormality involving the inferior vena cava.

15459.name: anterior mediastinal lesion
15459.description: Any mass or abnormality located in the anterior mediastinum.

14057.name: aortic aneurysm
14057.description: Abnormal dilation of a segment of the aorta, usually due to weakening of the vessel wall.

13538.name: aortic arch anomaly
13538.description: Congenital abnormality involving the aortic arch shape, course, or branching.

13496.name: aortic insufficiency
13496.description: A condition where the aortic valve fails to close completely, causing regurgitation of blood into the left ventricle.

22509.name: aortic valve disease
22509.description: General term encompassing disorders of the aortic valve including stenosis and regurgitation.

14919.name: asymmetric lung size
14919.description: One lung is noticeably larger or smaller relative to the other.

16069.name: axillary mass
16069.description: Abnormal soft tissue mass located in the axillary (armpit) region.

14957.name: bilateral basilar lung disease
14957.description: Disease process involving both lower lobes of the lungs.

16111.name: bilateral elevated diaphragm
16111.description: Both hemidiaphragms appear elevated relative to normal anatomic position.

20321.name: bilateral flat diaphragm
20321.description: Both hemidiaphragms appear abnormally flattened, often due to hyperinflation.

15759.name: bilateral hilar enlargement
15759.description: Increase in the size or density of the hilar regions, commonly due to lymphadenopathy or vascular causes.

14849.name: bilateral hyperinflated lungs
14849.description: Both lungs appear overinflated with increased lung volume.

14908.name: bilateral pulmonary underaeration
14908.description: Both lungs show decreased aeration, often appearing denser on imaging.

5533.name: biliary-pleural fistula
5533.description: Abnormal communication between the biliary system and pleural space.

15312.name: bronchial lesion
15312.description: An abnormality or mass involving a bronchus.

13943.name: bronchiectasis
13943.description: Abnormal, irreversible dilatation of bronchi due to chronic inflammation or infection.

14902.name: bubbly lungs in infants and children
14902.description: Appearance of multiple small cystic or bubbly lucencies in the lungs of pediatric patients.

32870.name: calcification in heart
32870.description: Presence of calcified deposits within cardiac structures.

15553.name: calcified mediastinal mass
15553.description: A mass in the mediastinum containing areas of calcification.

16222.name: calcified pulmonary metastasis
16222.description: Metastatic lung lesion with areas of calcification.

13791.name: cardiac or pericardial neoplasm or cyst
13791.description: A tumor or cystic lesion within the heart or pericardial space.

30930.name: cardiomegaly in childhood
30930.description: Enlarged heart size seen in pediatric patients.

13752.name: cardiomyopathy
13752.description: Diseases of the heart muscle causing impaired function.

14751.name: cavitary lung lesion in an infant or child
14751.description: Area within the lung containing an air-filled cavity, identified in pediatric patients.

14589.name: centrilobular small lung nodules
14589.description: Small nodules located in the centrilobular region of the lungs.

15155.name: chemical-induced lung disease
15155.description: Lung disease caused by exposure to toxic chemicals.

16091.name: chest malformation
16091.description: Abnormal structural development of the bony or soft tissue chest.

16049.name: chest wall lesion
16049.description: A lesion located within or on the chest wall.

14557.name: chronic air-space consolidation
14557.description: Persistent opacification of the lung parenchyma due to filling of air-spaces.

14261.name: chronic aspiration pneumonia in a child
14261.description: Recurrent or persistent lung infection in children due to chronic aspiration.

14274.name: chronic disseminated air-space opacity
14274.description: Widespread, persistent lung opacities affecting air-spaces, seen over time.

14427.name: chronic Kerley lines
14427.description: Persistent, fine linear lung opacities indicative of interstitial edema or fibrosis.

14212.name: chronic pulmonary lobar consolidation
14212.description: Long-standing opacity of an entire lung lobe due to consolidation.

15960.name: chylothorax
15960.description: Collection of lymphatic fluid (chyle) in the pleural space.

31859.name: clavicle dysplasia
31859.description: Abnormal formation or development of the clavicle.

31727.name: clavicle hypoplasia
31727.description: Underdevelopment or incomplete formation of the clavicle.

13476.name: complete atrioventricular canal
13476.description: A congenital heart defect with a common atrioventricular valve and septal defects.

13449.name: complicated atrial shunt
13449.description: Presence of an abnormal communication between atria with complications such as shunt reversal or obstruction.

13765.name: congenital cardiomyopathy
13765.description: Heart muscle disease present from birth.

13234.name: congenital heart disease
13234.description: Structural heart abnormalities present from birth.

13550.name: congenital heart disease with anterior right aortic arch
13550.description: Congenital cardiac malformation associated with aortic arch located anteriorly and to the right.
synonyms: right anterior aortic arch with congenital heart defect

13519.name: congenital heart disease with decreased pulmonary vascularity
13519.description: Congenital heart defects associated with reduced blood flow to the lungs.
synonyms: cyanotic heart disease with reduced pulmonary blood flow

14880.name: congenital lobar emphysema
14880.description: Overinflation of one or more lung lobes present from birth.

22613.name: congenital tracheal stenosis
22613.description: Narrowing of the trachea present at birth.

2331.name: constrictive pericarditis
2331.description: Chronic inflammation of the pericardium resulting in constriction of the heart.

14078.name: coronary artery aneurysm
14078.description: Localized dilatation of a coronary artery segment.

13503.name: cyanotic congenital heart disease with increased pulmonary vascularity
13503.description: Cyanotic heart defects with increased blood flow to the lungs.
synonyms: cyanotic CHD with increased pulm blood flow

13510.name: cyanotic congenital heart disease with precapillary hypertension vascularity
13510.description: Cyanotic heart disease with signs of pulmonary arterial hypertension.
synonyms: cyanotic CHD with precapillary pulmonary hypertension

15592.name: cystic mediastinal mass
15592.description: A cystic lesion located in the mediastinum.

31038.name: defect in distal sternum
31038.description: A structural anomaly or absence in the lower part of the sternum.

13596.name: dextrocardia
13596.description: Heart positioned on the right side of the chest.

25603.name: diaphragm dysfunction
25603.description: Abnormal function or movement of the diaphragm.

22456.name: diaphragmatic hernia
22456.description: Protrusion of abdominal contents into the thoracic cavity through the diaphragm.

14520.name: diffuse interstitial disease with pleural effusion
14520.description: Widespread interstitial lung disease with fluid in the pleural space.
synonyms: interstitial lung disease with pleural fluid

14529.name: diffuse interstitial lung disease with associated lymphadenopathy
14529.description: Diffuse interstitial involvement of the lungs and enlarged lymph nodes.

14405.name: diffuse mixed airspace-interstitial lung disease
14405.description: Combination of airspace and interstitial lung disease in a diffuse pattern.

15663.name: displacement of the thoracic paraspinal line
15663.description: Alteration in the location of the paraspinal interface on imaging.

14070.name: dissecting aneurysm of the ascending aorta or arch
14070.description: Dissecting aneurysm involving the ascending aorta or aortic arch.

3557.name: diverticulum of upper esophagus
3557.description: A pouch-like outpouching from the upper esophagus.

16228.name: eggshell calcification in the chest
16228.description: Thin, peripheral calcification of lymph nodes, commonly in the mediastinum.

14088.name: embolus
14088.description: A clot or other material that travels and obstructs a blood vessel, often in the pulmonary arteries.

15562.name: enhancing mediastinal mass
15562.description: A mediastinal mass that shows contrast enhancement, suggestive of neoplastic or vascular process.

14012.name: enlarged pulmonary veins
14012.description: Dilated pulmonary veins, often seen with left-sided heart failure or increased pulmonary venous pressure.

22479.name: esophageal rupture
22479.description: A tear or perforation in the esophagus, leading to air or fluid leakage into the mediastinum.

14833.name: extensive pulmonary opacity with cavitation
14833.description: Large area of lung opacity with cavitation, seen in infections, malignancy, or infarction.

15945.name: exudative pleural effusion
15945.description: Pleural fluid collection with high protein content, often due to infection or malignancy.

15524.name: fat-attenuation mediastinal mass
15524.description: A mediastinal mass with fat-density, characteristic of lipoma or thymolipoma.

19061.name: fetal chest mass
19061.description: A mass detected within the chest of a fetus, which may be congenital or neoplastic.

13635.name: filling defect in right ventricle
13635.description: An abnormal area within the right ventricle where contrast does not fill, often due to thrombus or tumor.

13830.name: gas embolism
13830.description: The presence of gas bubbles within the vascular system, potentially causing obstruction.

13892.name: generalized pulmonary arterial hypervascularity
13892.description: Increased prominence and number of pulmonary arteries throughout the lungs.

13998.name: generalized pulmonary arterial hypovascularity
13998.description: Reduced caliber and number of pulmonary arteries visualized throughout the lung fields.

14547.name: ground-glass pulmonary opacity
14547.description: Hazy increased lung opacity with preserved bronchial and vascular markings.

30931.name: heart failure in childhood
30931.description: Cardiac dysfunction leading to inadequate perfusion, presenting after infancy.

13347.name: heart failure in the first month of life
13347.description: Cardiac failure occurring in infants less than one month old.

13338.name: heart failure in the first week of life
13338.description: Cardiac failure presenting within the first week of life, often due to congenital heart disease.

15952.name: hemothorax
15952.description: Accumulation of blood in the pleural space, usually due to trauma or rupture.

13743.name: high-output heart function
13743.description: State of increased cardiac output secondary to a variety of causes.

15791.name: hilar displacement
15791.description: Abnormal position of the pulmonary hilum, often due to mass effect or lung volume loss.

15054.name: hypersensitivity pneumonitis
15054.description: An inflammatory lung disease caused by repeated inhalation of environmental antigens.

13723.name: hypertension
13723.description: Elevated systemic arterial blood pressure; not directly diagnosable by chest imaging.

14380.name: ill-defined multifocal lung opacities
14380.description: Multiple poorly marginated areas of increased attenuation within the lungs.

14567.name: increased lung lucency
14567.description: Areas of the lungs appearing darker than normal due to increased air or decreased density.

14982.name: indistinct heart border on frontal chest radiograph
14982.description: Loss of the clear demarcation between the heart border and adjacent lung on frontal radiographs.

15245.name: infectious lung disease
15245.description: Any infection involving lung parenchyma, such as pneumonia or tuberculosis.

14141.name: inferior vena cava obstruction
14141.description: Blockage of the inferior vena cava, which can cause venous congestion and collateral circulation.

14491.name: interstitial lung fibrosis
14491.description: Thickening and scarring of the lung interstitium.

15677.name: intrathoracic extramedullary hematopoiesis
15677.description: Formation of blood cells in thoracic sites outside the bone marrow, often as paravertebral masses.

15358.name: intratracheal mass
15358.description: A mass lesion located within the tracheal lumen.

13732.name: ischemic heart disease
13732.description: A group of heart conditions caused by reduced blood flow to the myocardium.

16177.name: juxtadiaphragmatic lesions in children
16177.description: Lesions located adjacent to the diaphragm seen in pediatric patients.

30876.name: large aortic arch
30876.description: Enlargement or increased diameter of the aortic arch.

30875.name: large ascending aorta
30875.description: Enlargement of the ascending segment of the aorta.

13910.name: large main pulmonary artery
13910.description: Widening or enlargement of the main pulmonary artery.

15383.name: large trachea
15383.description: Abnormally increased diameter of the trachea.

22609.name: laryngeal anomaly
22609.description: Congenital or acquired structural abnormality of the larynx.

13432.name: late onset of cyanosis in neonatal congenital heart disease
13432.description: Development of cyanosis after birth in neonates due to underlying congenital cardiac defects.
synonyms: delayed cyanosis in congenital heart disease

3695.name: left atrial enlargement
3695.description: Increased size of the left atrium, often due to cardiac or valvular disease.

13685.name: left ventricular enlargement
13685.description: Increased size of the left ventricle, often due to cardiac overload or disease.

13396.name: left-to-right shunt in congenital heart disease
13396.description: Abnormal blood flow from the left to the right side of the heart due to a congenital defect.

32553.name: lobar atelectasis
32553.description: Collapse or loss of volume in an entire lobe of the lung.

14933.name: localized chronic pulmonary opacity
14933.description: A persistent area of increased density in the lung, typically indicating a chronic process.

16164.name: localized elevation of hemidiaphragm
16164.description: Abnormal elevation of one side of the diaphragm often indicating underlying pathology.

3934.name: localized narrowing of esophagus
3934.description: Focal constriction of the esophagus, which may be congenital, neoplastic, or due to inflammation.

13972.name: localized pulmonary vessel enlargement
13972.description: A segmentally enlarged artery or vein in the lung, sometimes associated with shunts or malformations.

15001.name: long linear lung shadow
15001.description: A straight or slightly curved linear opacity seen within the lung on imaging.

14573.name: lower lung disease
14573.description: Disease predominantly affecting the lower lobes or zones of the lungs.

14788.name: lung abscess
14788.description: A localized collection of pus within the lung parenchyma caused by infection.

15042.name: lung disease with eosinophilia
15042.description: A group of disorders characterized by lung involvement and increased eosinophils.

14592.name: lung neoplasm
14592.description: A primary or secondary tumor of the lung including benign and malignant lesions.

13987.name: main pulmonary artery obstruction
13987.description: Blockage of the main pulmonary artery, most commonly due to thromboembolism.

13424.name: marked cyanosis in first week of life
13424.description: Severe bluish discoloration of skin in neonates caused by inadequate oxygenation, often due to congenital heart disease.

15755.name: marked hilar lymphadenopathy
15755.description: Significantly enlarged lymph nodes in the hilar regions.

14842.name: mass in a pulmonary cavity
14842.description: A soft tissue nodule or mass within a pre-existing lung cavity.

14683.name: mass-like perihilar opacity
14683.description: An opacity with mass effect near the hilum, possibly due to tumor, infection, or lymphadenopathy.

13774.name: massive cardiomegaly
13774.description: Severe enlargement of the heart beyond normal limits.

15972.name: massive pleural effusion
15972.description: A very large collection of fluid in the pleural space.

32920.name: mediastinal abscess
32920.description: A localized collection of pus within the mediastinal spaces.

15734.name: mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node enlargement
15734.description: Enlargement of lymph nodes in the mediastinum and/or hilar lung regions.

15800.name: mediastinal shift
15800.description: Displacement of the mediastinal structures to one side, usually due to volume loss or mass effect.

15481.name: middle mediastinal lesion
15481.description: A mass or abnormality located within the middle mediastinal compartment.

13429.name: mild or intermittent cyanosis in first week
13429.description: Bluish discoloration due to low oxygen levels in a neonate's first week, possible clinical sign of cardiopulmonary disease.

14443.name: miliary lung opacities
14443.description: Numerous small, diffuse, round pulmonary opacities throughout both lungs.

14460.name: miliary lung opacities in a neonate or young infant
14460.description: Diffuse, tiny pulmonary opacities in a young infant or neonate.

13499.name: mitral insufficiency
13499.description: Inadequate closure of the mitral valve, causing regurgitation of blood into the left atrium.

15330.name: mucoid impaction
15330.description: Plugging of bronchi with thick mucus, resulting in branching opacities.

16205.name: multifocal thoracic calcification
16205.description: Presence of calcified deposits at multiple sites in the thorax.

14814.name: multiple cavitary lung lesions
14814.description: Several areas in the lung with central lucency or cavities.

16041.name: multiple pleural masses
16041.description: More than one mass lesion arising from or involving the pleura.

14702.name: multiple pulmonary nodules
14702.description: Two or more round opacities scattered throughout the lungs.

14890.name: neonatal respiratory distress
14890.description: Difficulty in breathing and inadequate oxygenation in a newborn.

25796.name: nipple anomaly
25796.description: Abnormal development or appearance of the nipple.

16013.name: nodular pleural thickening
16013.description: Focal or diffuse thickening of the pleura with nodularity.

15284.name: opportunistic lung infection
15284.description: Pulmonary infection occurring in immunocompromised patients.

31039.name: oversegmentation of sternum
31039.description: Presence of more than normal segments or divisions in the sternum.

16148.name: paralyzed hemidiaphragm
16148.description: Loss of movement of one side of the diaphragm, usually due to nerve injury.

14606.name: pediatric chest tumor
14606.description: A neoplastic mass located in the chest of a pediatric patient.

16074.name: pediatric chest wall lesion
16074.description: Pathologic process affecting the chest wall in a child.

15377.name: pedunculated intratracheal mass
15377.description: A mass with a stalk projecting into the tracheal lumen.

14559.name: peribronchovascular interstitial thickening
14559.description: Thickening of the connective tissues around the bronchi and vessels, often associated with interstitial lung diseases.

13823.name: pericardial calcification
13823.description: Calcium deposition within the pericardium, frequently seen in chronic inflammation.

3706.name: pericardial effusion
3706.description: Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the pericardial sac.

14585.name: perilymphatic small lung nodules
14585.description: Small nodules distributed along lymphatic routes in the lung, often associated with sarcoidosis or pneumoconioses.

31734.name: periosteal reaction involving the clavicle
31734.description: New bone formation along the surface of the clavicle, possibly due to infection, trauma or neoplasia.

14993.name: peripheral lung lesion
14993.description: A mass or nodule located towards the periphery of the lung fields.

16157.name: phrenic nerve paralysis or dysfunction
16157.description: Loss or reduction of phrenic nerve function leading to diaphragmatic elevation or immobility.

16017.name: pleural calcification
16017.description: Deposition of calcium in the pleura, often a sign of previous inflammation or asbestos exposure.

15932.name: pleural effusion containing eosinophiles
15932.description: Pleural effusion with a high eosinophil count, often related to infection or trauma.

15922.name: pleural effusion with disease in abdomen
15922.description: Pleural fluid accumulation associated with abdominal pathology such as pancreatitis or cirrhosis.
synonyms: secondary pleural effusion due to abdominal disease

15893.name: pleural effusion with disease in thorax
15893.description: Pleural fluid accumulation secondary to intrathoracic diseases like pneumonia or malignancy.
synonyms: secondary pleural effusion due to thoracic disease

15917.name: pleural effusion with enlarged heart
15917.description: Pleural effusion seen in the context of cardiomegaly, suggestive of cardiac etiology.

15868.name: pleural effusion with normal lungs
15868.description: Pleural fluid accumulation present when lungs appear otherwise normal.

16030.name: pleural mass
16030.description: A discrete mass or tumor arising from the pleura.

15999.name: pleural thickening
15999.description: Chronic inflammation or fibrosis causing a thickened appearance of the pleura.

15091.name: pneumoconiosis
15091.description: A group of occupational interstitial lung diseases caused by inhalation of inorganic dust.

23340.name: pneumomediastinum
23340.description: Presence of gas or air within the mediastinum.

13851.name: pneumopericardium
13851.description: Presence of gas or air within the pericardial sac.

23339.name: pneumothorax
23339.description: Presence of gas or air in the pleural space.

15503.name: posterior mediastinal lesion
15503.description: A mass or abnormality located in the posterior compartment of the mediastinum.

22610.name: premature laryngeal cartilage calcification
22610.description: Calcification of the laryngeal cartilages earlier than typically expected by age.

22614.name: premature tracheobronchial cartilage calcification
22614.description: Early calcification of the tracheal or bronchial cartilages before the usual age.

13717.name: prosthetic valve regurgitation
13717.description: Leakage of blood backward through a prosthetic heart valve.

13932.name: pulmonary arterial hypertension
13932.description: Elevated pressure within the pulmonary arterial system.

13911.name: pulmonary artery aneurysm
13911.description: Abnormal focal dilatation of the pulmonary artery.

22547.name: pulmonary artery calcification
22547.description: Calcification within the wall of the pulmonary artery.

30927.name: pulmonary artery catheterization
30927.description: Presence of a catheter (Swan-Ganz) in the pulmonary artery.

23185.name: pulmonary artery rupture
23185.description: Tear or disruption of the pulmonary artery wall, often with bleeding.

22550.name: pulmonary artery stenosis
22550.description: Narrowing of the pulmonary artery or its branches.

15300.name: pulmonary disease in an immunodeficient patient
15300.description: Any lung disease occurring in a patient with immune deficiency, including infections and neoplasms.

14286.name: pulmonary edema
14286.description: Accumulation of fluid within the lung interstitium and alveoli.

22548.name: pulmonary embolism
22548.description: Blockage of a pulmonary artery branch by embolic material, usually a blood clot.

22551.name: pulmonary hypertension
22551.description: Increased pressure in the pulmonary vasculature.

33499.name: pulmonary lobar consolidation
33499.description: Solidification of a whole pulmonary lobe due to replacement of air with fluid, cells, or other material.

14208.name: pulmonary lobar enlargement
14208.description: Increased size of a pulmonary lobe, can be due to air trapping or other etiologies.

33498.name: pulmonary segmental consolidation
33498.description: Consolidation confined to a segment of the lung.

15983.name: radiopaque hemithorax
15983.description: Appearance of an entire side of the chest being abnormally dense on imaging.

14588.name: randomly distributed small lung nodules
14588.description: Multiple small round opacities scattered randomly throughout the lung parenchyma.

14969.name: retrocardiac lesion
14969.description: Abnormal lesion located posterior to the heart.

15603.name: retrosternal mass
15603.description: Mass located in the anterior mediastinum, behind the sternum.

14363.name: reverse butterfly pattern
14363.description: Bilateral symmetric peripheral opacities with central sparing, resembling an inverted butterfly wing pattern.

25461.name: ribbon-like ribs
25461.description: Ribs that appear thin and elongated on imaging, usually seen in conditions that affect bone development.

15636.name: right anterior cardiophrenic angle lesion
15636.description: A focal mass or opacity located in the right anterior cardiophrenic angle.

13602.name: right atrial enlargement
13602.description: Increase in the size of the right atrium, often due to cardiac or pulmonary disease.

13623.name: right ventricular enlargement
13623.description: Enlargement of the right ventricle, seen in pulmonary or cardiac pathology.

13437.name: right-to-left atrial shunt
13437.description: Abnormal passage allowing blood to move from the right atrium to the left atrium.

13478.name: right-to-left shunt at ductus level
13478.description: Abnormal passage of blood from the right to left through a persistent ductus arteriosus.
synonyms: patent ductus arteriosus with right-to-left shunt

13412.name: right-to-left shunt or admixture lesion in congenital heart disease
13412.description: Presence of cardiac or vascular lesions in congenital heart disease that allow deoxygenated blood to mix with oxygenated blood.

13458.name: right-to-left ventricular shunt
13458.description: Abnormal communication allowing blood flow from the right to left ventricle.

31733.name: sclerotic clavicle
31733.description: Increased density or thickening of the clavicle seen on imaging.

32554.name: segmental atelectasis
32554.description: Collapse of a segment of a lung resulting in volume loss and increased opacity.

14690.name: shaggy lung nodule
14690.description: An irregular or spiculated lung nodule, often concerning for malignancy.

16084.name: short narrow thoracic cage
16084.description: A thoracic cage that is both diminished in height and width, usually congenital.

22615.name: short trachea
22615.description: A trachea that is abnormally short, potentially congenital or due to surgical resection.

30873.name: small ascending aorta
30873.description: Diminutive diameter of the ascending aorta, which can be developmental or associated with specific syndromes.

13783.name: small heart
13783.description: A heart that appears reduced in size relative to the thoracic cavity.

14576.name: small lung nodules
14576.description: Discrete, small round opacities in the lung parenchyma.

15913.name: small pleural effusion with subsegmental atelectasis
15913.description: Minimal fluid accumulation in pleural space associated with collapse of a subsegment of lung.

15629.name: small thymus in an infant
15629.description: Thymus gland is smaller than expected for age in an infant.

15538.name: soft-tissue mediastinal mass
15538.description: Mass or lesion composed of soft tissue within the mediastinum.

14779.name: solitary irregular cavitary lung lesion
14779.description: A single lung lesion with irregular cavity, often raising suspicion for infection or malignancy.

14646.name: solitary pulmonary mass
14646.description: A single abnormal mass seen in lung parenchyma greater than 3 cm.

14616.name: solitary pulmonary nodule
14616.description: A single rounded opacity in the lung less than or equal to 3 cm.

14772.name: solitary sharply-outlined cavitary lung lesion
14772.description: A single lung cavity with distinct, smooth borders.

16184.name: solitary thoracic calcification
16184.description: A single focus of calcification anywhere in the thorax.

15428.name: superior mediastinal mass
15428.description: An abnormal mass located in the superior mediastinum.

14124.name: superior vena cava syndrome
14124.description: Obstruction of the superior vena cava causing venous congestion and swelling.

14021.name: systemic-to-pulmonary vascular shunt
14021.description: An abnormal vascular connection between the systemic and pulmonary circulations.

14743.name: thick-walled lung cavity
14743.description: A lung cavity with relatively thick walls, often suggestive of infection or malignancy.

31728.name: thin clavicle
31728.description: Clavicle appears abnormally thin, possibly due to dysplasia or chronic disease.

14723.name: thin-walled lung cavity
14723.description: A lung cavity with thin walls, may suggest benign etiology or certain infections.

13669.name: third mogul sign
13669.description: A radiographic sign of enlargement of the left atrial appendage.

25733.name: thoracic dysplasia
25733.description: Abnormal development or formation of the thoracic structures, typically congenital.

9601.name: thoracolumbar gibbus
9601.description: Sharp angular kyphosis at thoracolumbar junction, often due to vertebral collapse or dysplasia.

15619.name: thymic enlargement
15619.description: Enlargement of the thymus gland, often seen in various conditions.

15404.name: tracheal displacement
15404.description: Abnormal shift of the trachea from its usual midline position.

22618.name: tracheobronchomegaly
22618.description: Abnormal dilatation of the trachea and bronchi, often congenital.

27873.name: tracheoesophageal fistula
27873.description: An abnormal connection between the trachea and esophagus.

22616.name: tracheomalacia
22616.description: Weakness of the tracheal wall, causing collapse during expiration.

15941.name: transudative pleural effusion
15941.description: Accumulation of non-inflammatory fluid in the pleural space, usually due to systemic factors like heart failure or hypoalbuminemia.

13527.name: tricuspid insufficiency
13527.description: Incompetent tricuspid valve causing regurgitation of blood from right ventricle to right atrium.

31040.name: undersegmentation of sternum
31040.description: Congenital failure of normal segmentation of the sternum, with fewer than usual parts visible.

14944.name: unilateral diffuse lung disease
14944.description: Widespread parenchymal abnormality affecting only one lung.

20320.name: unilateral flat diaphragm
20320.description: Flattening of one hemidiaphragm, often indicating volume loss or air trapping.

15764.name: unilateral hilar enlargement
15764.description: Increased size of the hilar structures on one side, often due to adenopathy or vascular abnormality.

33506.name: unilateral hyperlucency of chest
33506.description: Increased radiolucency of one hemithorax, often caused by air trapping or technical factors.

13902.name: unilateral pulmonary arterial hypervascularity
13902.description: Increased blood flow or density of pulmonary arteries on one side.

14316.name: unilateral pulmonary edema
14316.description: Edema affecting one lung or lobe, usually from cardiac, vascular or airway causes.

15780.name: unilateral small hilar shadow
15780.description: Diminished size of the hilar shadow on one side, often due to hypoplasia or prior surgery.

16125.name: unilaterally elevated diaphragm
16125.description: Elevation of one hemidiaphragm, typically due to paralysis, eventration, or abdominal pathology.

14570.name: upper lung disease
14570.description: Disease processes predominantly affecting the upper lobes of the lungs.

15125.name: vapor-induced lung disease
15125.description: Lung injury or abnormality secondary to inhalation of vaporized substances.

15571.name: vascular abnormality of mediastinum
15571.description: Abnormal appearance or course of a vascular structure within the mediastinum.

13463.name: ventricular septal defect
13463.description: A congenital opening between the right and left ventricles of the heart.

15530.name: water-attenuation mediastinal lesion
15530.description: A lesion in the mediastinum that has density similar to water on CT imaging.

15685.name: wide mediastinum
15685.description: Increased width of the mediastinum, which may indicate mass, hemorrhage, or vascular anomaly.

15414.name: wide right tracheal stripe
15414.description: An increased thickness of the right para-tracheal soft tissue stripe seen on chest radiograph.

15446.name: wide superior mediastinum in an infant or child
15446.description: Enlargement of the superior mediastinum in a pediatric patient that may indicate pathology or normal thymus.

14464.name: widespread small irregular lung opacities
14464.description: Numerous small, non-uniform lung opacities scattered throughout both lungs.
